At that time, the Four Heavenly Kings who protect the world addressed the Buddha, saying:
World-Honored One!
We four kings are all called protectors of the world. By what Dharma can we protect the world?
The Buddha told the Four Heavenly Kings:
You good people!
You should cultivate the practice of the true Dharma in order to protect the world.
The practice of the true Dharma refers to the ten wholesome deeds.
What are the ten?

First, not killing; second, being content with one's own wealth and pleasures without greed; third, not being lustful towards others' spouses; fourth, not dividing others' groups; fifth, not speaking evil words; sixth, speaking truthfully; seventh, speaking without adornment; eighth, not hoping for others' wealth and pleasures; ninth, ceasing anger; tenth, pure right view.
Good people!
These ten good dharmas are able to protect the world.
There are also eight dharmas that are able to protect the world.
What are the eight?

First, being able to practice as taught; second, respecting teachers and elders everywhere; third, practicing the right path; fourth, having an upright mind; fifth, always having a gentle mind; sixth, always giving rise to a compassionate mind towards all sentient beings; seventh, not committing any offenses; eighth, gathering all wholesome roots.
Such eight dharmas are able to protect the world.
There are also six dharmas that can protect the world.

Fifth, in cultivating the precepts and the Dharma without interruption or deficiency, without impurity, not grasping what should be received, praised by wisdom, free from all blame, with such pure precepts and the Dharma, one practices together with good friends and those who have the same pure conduct as oneself, and also respects and cherishes them with a loving mind. This is the fifth benefit of harmony in precept cultivation.

Sixth, in the teachings of right view and liberation, and in the factors of the path of seeing, one practices accordingly together with good friends and those who have the same pure conduct as oneself, and also respects and cherishes them with a loving mind. This is the sixth benefit of harmony in the same view.
Good people!
These six harmonious dharmas are able to protect the world.
There are also four dharmas that can protect the world.
What are the four?
First, not being greedy. Because of not being greedy, one does not fall into evil destinies.
Second, not being angry. Because of not being angry, one does not fall into evil destinies.
Third, not being deluded. Because of not being deluded, one does not fall into evil destinies.
Fourth, not being afraid. Because of not being afraid, one does not fall into evil destinies.
Good people!
Such four dharmas are able to protect the world.
There are also two dharmas that can protect the world.
What are the two?
First, having a sense of shame. Second, having a sense of remorse.
Possessing these two dharmas is able to protect the world.
There is also one dharma that can protect the world.
What is the one?
It refers to true practice.
Because of being true, it is able to protect the world.
Moreover, good speech and being without flattery, these one dharmas are all able to protect the world.
Good people!
If you diligently practice such dharmas, you will be able to protect the world. Having protected yourselves, you will also enable others to protect the world.
